title: April 2025 - Our Amazing Grasslands - Leopold Winner Blioux River Ranch

tasks.task: Expressing agronomy philosophy and influence of experts.
subtasks: Explain the difference between no-till and regenerative agriculture.
Name and acknowledge influential figures like Jim Garrish and Steve Kenyon.
Describe the impact of Gabe Brown’s approach on the speaker's farm.
Highlight the importance of considering local context and climate in agricultural practices.
Discuss the transition from spring wheat to winter wheat to extend growing season for cover crops.
Mention contributions from organizations like the South Dakota Grassland Coalition and Soil Health Coalition.

tasks.task: Detail farming practices and experiments for soil health improvement.
subtasks: Convert cropland to pasture and then back to cropland for experimentation.
Utilize diverse cover crop species to enhance soil health.
Adapt strategies for different soil types, recognizing the need to reverse previous practices.

tasks.task: Set goals and aspirations for the farm's future.
subtasks: Commit to staying on the land and improving its value through regenerative practices.
Aim to restore historic land use methods, such as buffalo migration patterns.
Envision a multi-generational family farm legacy.
